summary: Having lived and worked in a diverse variety of countries and cultures, I am able to combine those experiences to find creative solutions to adhoc challenges and exceeding set goals. With the mission to raise the bar in customer service, I would say communication, training, process management and leadership are my happy places.

profile_positions.description:
•	Responsible for day-to-day customer service operations EMEA
•	Identifying and reducing frictions on the consumer journey by isolating pain points, setting improvement plans and leading to their execution
•	Promoting and encouraging a customer–focused culture
•	Creating and maintaining the department knowledge base
•	Creating meaningful, long-lasting relationships with end customers, partners and distributors
•	Resolving AR cold cases
•	Contributing analysis and conclusions to organizational strategic plans and reviews
•	Continuously identifying outliers, risks and opportunities for daily strategic decisions
•	Weekly report presentations to leadership
•	On-going monitoring and improvement activities for internal processes
•	Developing and implementing improvement initiatives enhancing inter-departmental collaboration

profile_positions.description:
1st line manager technical support Benelux market Teleperformance Portugal.

Achievements:
-Nominated for Company Best monthly performer August 2014
-Produced Best Monthly Agent Performer in March, April and June 2014

Responsible for a team consisting of 15 - 20 agents, acting as their manager, coach and trainer. Mainly responsible for ensuring various daily project KPI's are met by using real time management tools . Daily use of management techniques, monitoring and evaluations to achieve continuous improvement on both team and agent level.

LEADERSHIP & COACHING
Created and implemented individual development files for each agent containing achieved results and clear targets enabling day to day coaching opportunities. These were carried out through coaching sessions and close to the agents side by side. Developing and implementing action plans devised to address outliers and provide steps for success. Weekly team meetings were held for updating the team on recent project / company developments and activities, identifying bottle necks and acting as an outlet moment for agents. Responsible for developing and implementing motivational campaigns.

HIRING & FIRING
Responsible for team hiring and firing, evaluating all CV's and conducting all interviews for potential candidates to join the project team. 

Other tasks:
• Qualitative and quantitative shift reporting.
• Various administrative tasks with internal tools (Scheduling, Real-time management, etc).
• Writing and providing feedback on Agent's continuity in the Project and reporting to upper management.
• Monitoring attendance, attrition and absenteeism of agents..
• Floorwalker: providing support to all agents on the floor.
profile_positions.title: 1st line Manager - Philips

profile_positions.description:
CMR Team Coordinator Italy, Spain, Portugal, Italy and Benelux. 
CMR Business Controls / Internal Quality Management

At the IBM Service Center of Excellence, our department manages the entire worldwide customer database.

(March - 2010) Administrator CMR - Benelux 

Involved with the ramp-up during transfer from USA to Slovakia. Participation in creating / updating work processes and documents. Processing all incoming requests according to SLA targets and guidelines, thus ensuring all customer data is correct and up to date. Maintaining good relationships with counterparts through providing excellent customer service. Attending team meetings and reporting on activities. Conduct periodical control activities. 


(September 2010) Team lead

By constantly organizing educational & training activities and introducing working processes adapted to the current circumstances I was able to increase and maintain the efficiency of all countries in scope. 

Being one of the department’s main focal points for many internal global projects has helped establish excellent relations with other international departments of IBM, which enabled fast solutions when needed. Attending management meetings and being main focal point for internal presentations and result reporting. 

Executing and reporting on Internal Quality Management activities, evaluating quality result reports and creating action plans where improvement is needed and do the proper follow up. 

Coordinating the IBM worldwide internal business control activities for entire department, which ensures a clean and ethical customer base for IBM worldwide. Result reporting directly to business control management in Slovakia and Washington, US.

-	Yielded excellent relations with global counterparts of IBM, leading to  focus on internal global projects, enabling fast solutions;
-	Participated in internal  ‘Leadership’ courses;
-	Processed 2,5 years of overdue work in Business Controls within 1 month, reducing a 2,5 year backlog.
profile_positions.title: CMR Team Coordinator Benelux / IT / Spain / Portugal ; CMR Business Controls IQM

profile_positions.description:
Key activity of the team was managing existing contracts with business partners in fo the company's Italy Product, marketing the product continuously on the Dutch market by reacting on daily sales and behavior of the key markets. Besides reading the market behavior and daily contact with business partners, our team was responsibe for in the creation of the product’s brochure and managing its online booking site.   

Through participating in a buyers training program, I participated in several contracting trips to Austria and Switzerland, during which contracts were (re)negotiated with existing and future business partners for the coming season (winter and summer). With visiting over 50 business partners within a 7 day trip, key skills needed were negotiating and knowledge of both the product and the market.  

Acting as the main point of contact for all Italian business partners who only spoke Italian I was mainly responsible for continueing & createing excellent relations with local tourism business owners through verbal contact.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Product Manager

profile_positions.description:
Management Assistant at the Holiday Inn Yangzte Hotel, located in Chongqing, China. 

- Focal point for all Western and English speaking guests complaints, requests, Q&A and solutions.
- Involved with sales / marketing for Western parties. 
- Sole responsibility for the creation of the 2008 event calendar for all facilities & amenities of the hotel, including action plans, promotional activities and revenue predictions. 
- Involved in organizing and executing large-scale in-house events, from weddings to concerts.


Departments; Sales & Marketing, Front Desk management, Food & Beverages, Guest Relations and PR.

Personal Project P.R.: creation of the event calendar 2008 for all amenities of the hotel, with execution- & promotional action plans and revenue schemes.
profile_positions.title: Management Assistant - Holiday Inn Hotel Yangtze, China

profile_positions.description:
As part of this team you are the Face of the Village, as you are the first face the guests see in the morning, the face the guests see throughout the entire day and the last face the see before going to bed. You act as a focal point for all possible matters for the guests and responsible for every interaction with the guests without shifting responsibility to someone else. 

As part of this team you can make or break the holidays for the guests and act accordingly to that knowledge. 

- Focal point for all guests for complaints, requests, Q&A and solutions in various languages.
- Taking part in creating and executing the daily entertainment and reward programs.
- Taking part in welcoming activities for arriving guests.
- Individually responsible for organizing large-scale events, from tournaments to social events.
profile_positions.title: Member of Guest Experience team
